summary: Most core frontend features for YouTube URL input + embed, chart import (MIDI/JSON), falling piano roll with transport controls, and keyboard hit/miss feedback appear implemented. However, the onboarding flow requires Internet Identity login before name entry (adds an extra required step vs REQ-1), backend “persistence” is implemented as an in-memory Map (not durable across upgrades/restarts) and is gated by an unrequested authorization system, and the required image assets are not present in the diff.

missing_requirements.requirement: On first app load (new session), the only required user input is a name field and a continue/start button, then go directly to practice without other steps.
missing_requirements.reason: The app shows a login screen (Internet Identity) before presenting the name field; this adds an additional required step beyond entering a name.

missing_requirements.requirement: Persist the user's name (and optionally last YouTube URL / last chart filename) in the backend so it is available when the user returns.
missing_requirements.reason: Backend stores profiles in a non-stable in-memory Map (`let userProfiles = Map.empty...`), with no stable storage shown; this does not demonstrate persistence across canister upgrades/redeploys.

missing_requirements.requirement: Provide required image assets: app-logo.dim_512x512.png and practice-bg.dim_1920x1080.png.
missing_requirements.reason: No image files are shown in the added/modified file list.

hallucinated_features.description: Authorization / access-control system with admin token initialization and permission checks around profile APIs.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by the BuildRequest; REQ-6 only asked for saving/loading the profile, not role-based authorization, admin permissions, or secret token initialization.

hallucinated_features.description: User account dropdown UI with "Change Name" and "Logout" actions.
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested; the BuildRequest only specifies minimal onboarding (name) and practice flow features.

hallucinated_features.description: Footer attribution link and heart symbol ("Built with ❤️ using caffeine.ai").
hallucinated_features.reason: Not requested by any requirement; also introduces extra user-facing content unrelated to the app goals.
